TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE . He was represented before ORG , a lawyer practising in GPE . The respondent Government were represented by their Agent , PERSON , Representative of GPE at ORG .
CARDINAL . NORP The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
CARDINAL . NORP Since DATE the applicant has been living in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE he instituted civil proceedings against his brother , seeking to have annulled a number of documents relating to his brother ’s acquisition of their deceased father ’s estate and to be recognised as CARDINAL of the heirs . He alleged that his father , prior to his death in DATE , had made a will which named him and his brother as heirs . The notary , when formalising the inheritance in DATE pursuant to the law , had failed to verify this circumstance before issuing his brother and mother with an inheritance certificate .

CARDINAL . On DATE the GPE and ORG of GPE ( PERSON և Նորք-Մարաշ համայնքների առաջին ատյանի դատարան ) examined and dismissed the applicant ’s claim as unsubstantiated . ORG found that the applicant had been aware of his father ’s death and was therefore aware that an inheritance procedure had been opened . In spite of this , he had missed DATE time - limit prescribed by law to claim the inheritance .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant lodged an appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( ՀՀ քաղաքացիական գործերով վերաքննիչ դատարան ) upheld the judgment of ORG , reaching similar conclusions .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal on points of law with ORG ( ՀՀ վճռաբեկ դատարան ) , claiming various substantive violations of the law . Pursuant to LAW ( “ the ORG ” ) , he argued that these violations would have grave consequences , namely the loss of his property . He further argued that the decision to be adopted by ORG would have a significant impact on the uniform application of the law , claiming that a person was not obliged to know about the existence of a will on DATE of the testator ’s death . He finally argued that the judgment of ORG contradicted a decision of ORG adopted on DATE in connection with another dispute . A copy of that decision was attached to the applicant ’s appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , sitting in camera as a panel of CARDINAL judges , decided to return the appeal , that is , to declare it inadmissible . The reasons provided were as follows :
“ ORG of ORG ... having examined the question of admitting [ the applicant ’s appeal lodged against the judgment of ORG of DATE ] , found that it must be returned with the following reasoning :
Pursuant to LAW ( CARDINAL ) of [ the ORG ] an appeal on points of law must contain any of the grounds [ required by ] LAW of [ the ORG ] .
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of the LAW read as follows :
“ Everyone has the right to an effective remedy to have his rights and freedoms protected by the judicial and other public authorities .
Everyone has the right to defend his rights and freedoms by any means not prohibited by law . ... ”

“ Everyone has the right to a public hearing of his case by an independent and impartial court within a reasonable time in conditions of equality and with respect for all fair trial requirements in order to have his violated rights restored , as well as the validity of the charge against him determined . ... ”
“ ... The highest judicial instance in GPE , except matters falling within constitutional jurisdiction , is ORG which is called upon to ensure the uniform application of the law . ... ”
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of the ORG , as in force at the material time , read as follows :
Article CARDINAL : Entry into force of judgments of ORG
“ Judgments of ORG enter into force from the moment of their delivery . ”
Article CARDINAL : Review of judicial acts through cassation proceedings

“ CARDINAL . Judgments of the first instance courts , ORG and ORG which have entered into force ... can be reviewed through cassation proceedings based on the appeals brought by persons indicated in LAW . ”
LAW entitled to bring appeals on points of law

“ CARDINAL . Appeals on points of law against judgments of lower courts which have entered into force can be brought by ( CARDINAL ) the parties to the proceedings ; [ and ] ( CARDINAL ) persons who were not parties to the proceedings but whose rights and obligations were affected by the judicial act deciding on the merits of the case . ”
“ CARDINAL . Appeals on points of law lodged against judgments of the first instance courts , ORG and ORG which have entered into force ... are examined by ORG ( hereafter , ORG ) .
CARDINAL . NORP The objective of ORG activity is to ensure the uniform application of the law and its correct interpretation , and to promote the development of the law . ”
“ An appeal on points of law can be lodged on the ground of ... a substantive or a procedural violation of the parties’ rights ... ”
“ CARDINAL . An appeal on points of law can be lodged within DATE from the date of entry into force of the judicial act of a lower court deciding on the merits of the case . ”

“ CARDINAL . An appeal on points of law must contain ( CARDINAL ) the name of the court to which the appeal is addressed ; ( CARDINAL ) the appellant ’s name ; ( CARDINAL ) the name of the court that has adopted the judgment , the case number , the date on which the judgment was adopted , the names of the parties , and the subject - matter of the dispute ; ( CARDINAL ) the appellant ’s claim , with reference to the laws and other legal acts and specifying which provisions of substantive or procedural law have been violated or wrongly applied ... ; ( CARDINAL ) arguments required by any of the subparagraphs of paragraph CARDINAL of Article CARDINAL of this Code ; [ and ] ( CARDINAL ) a list of documents enclosed with the appeal .
CARDINAL . An appeal on points of law shall be signed by the appellant .
CARDINAL . A document certifying payment of the ORG fee shall be attached to the appeal . ”

“ CARDINAL . An appeal on points of law shall be returned if it does not comply with the requirements of LAW and paragraph CARDINAL of LAW of this LAW or if it has been lodged by a person whose rights have not been violated .
CARDINAL . The Court of Cassation shall adopt a decision to return an appeal on points of law within DATE after the receipt of the appeal .
CARDINAL . NORP In its decision to return an appeal on points of law ORG may fix a time - limit for correcting the shortcoming and lodging the appeal anew . ”

“ CARDINAL . ORG shall admit an appeal on points of law , if ( CARDINAL ) the judicial act to be adopted on the given case by ORG may have a significant impact on the uniform application of the law , or ( CARDINAL ) the contested judicial act contradicts a judicial act previously adopted by ORG , or ( CARDINAL ) a violation of the procedural or the substantive law by the lower court may cause grave consequences , or ( CARDINAL ) there are newly discovered circumstances .

CARDINAL . The Court of Cassation sitting as a panel composed of the President of ORG and the judges of the chamber shall decide whether appeals on points of law lodged with ORG comply with the requirements of LAW and paragraph CARDINAL of this article and should be admitted .
CARDINAL . An appeal on points of law shall be admitted if CARDINAL of the judges of ORG vote in favour of admitting it . This decision of ORG is not subject to appeal . ”

CARDINAL . The above Articles CARDINAL.CARDINAL and CARDINAL of the ORG were amended into ORG CARDINAL and CARDINAL by the LAW DATE with effect from DATE , following ORG decision of DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) , and read as follows :

“ ... CARDINAL . ORG of the Court of Cassation shall adopt a decision to return an appeal on points of law within DATE after the receipt of the case file by ORG . The decision to return an appeal on points of law must be reasoned , except for the cases in which an appeal on points of law is returned for the lack of the ground stipulated by LAW . ... ”

“ CARDINAL . ORG shall admit an appeal on points of law if , in its opinion , the appeal substantiates that ( CARDINAL ) the decision of ORG concerning the question raised in the appeal may have a significant impact on the uniform application of the law , or ( CARDINAL ) the contested judicial act prima facie contradicts a decision previously adopted by ORG , or ( CARDINAL ) a prima facie judicial error made by the lower court which may cause or have caused grave consequences . ... ”
CARDINAL . The new LAW ORG was further amended by the PERSON of DATE with effect from DATE , following ORG decision of DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) and currently reads as follows :

“ ... CARDINAL . ORG shall adopt a decision to return an appeal on points of law within DATE after the receipt of the case file by ORG . The decision to return an appeal on points of law must be reasoned . ... ”

CARDINAL . The Constitutional Court found paragraph CARDINAL of Article CARDINAL in its part concerning the lack of a requirement to provide reasons for a decision to return an appeal on points of law incompatible with , inter alia , Articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL of the LAW , because it failed to ensure legal safeguards for an effective and accessible administration of justice . The remaining contested provisions were found to be compatible with LAW .

CARDINAL . The Constitutional Court found paragraph CARDINAL of Article CARDINAL in its part reading “ except for the cases in which an appeal on points of law is returned for the lack of the ground stipulated by LAW incompatible with Articles DATE and CARDINAL of the LAW . ORG noted that the amendments introduced following its decision of DATE did not sufficiently ensure the relevant legal guarantees . It found that the legislature , by including the exception in question , failed to ensure the implementation of the above - mentioned decision . ORG explained that the requirement of a reasoned decision did not concern this or that particular admissibility ground of an appeal on points of law , but concerned all such grounds . This requirement aimed at ensuring the legitimate and lawful exercise of the court ’s discretionary powers and an individual ’s confidence in a judicial act .
